newsitem.title: FRANCE: Five killed in French family feud shootout.
newsitem.headline: Five killed in French family feud shootout.

text.p: Five people, including two paramilitary gendarmes, were shot dead in a family feud in western France on Tuesday, police said.
They said a 50-year-old businessman stormed into the home of his companion's family and opened fire with a shotgun, killing three people and wounding the woman.
Two gendarmes, aged 31 and 33, who rushed to the scene were killed when the unnamed gunman pretended to surrender and shot them. He was later wounded and captured by another gendarme.
Another person was seriously wounded in the incident, near Chateaubourg, 20 kms (12 miles) from Rennes).
